content:
Hi there. I am currently not included in rfcbot's t-libs list. And this is good for now, as I don't think I currently have the time for that. However, I often need to FCP merge PRs but I can't do that. See this attempt for example, where someone needed to help me.

Is there a way for me to start FCP merges without being included in the "signoff list"? I would like to avoid having to ping someone else all the time. Or should I just reassign PRs requiring FCP merges to someone else?

@Lukas Kalbertodt rfcbot's list is based on rust-lang/team so right now you're not marked as being on the libs team at all. You should make a PR that adds yourself to the team. https://github.com/rust-lang/team

@XAMPPRocky I am already in the libs team there: https://github.com/rust-lang/team/blob/master/teams/libs.toml
I'm simply excluded from the rfcbot.
I wonder if there is a way for this hybrid.
@BurntSushi Can you start an FCP merge? Or is it just me who can't?
@Lukas Kalbertodt That would feel like a weird hybrid to me. You want to be able to start a voting process, but not be a voting member is that correct?
@Lukas Kalbertodt Is your exclusion from the rfcbot list intentional? We could just drop that exclusion...
Looks like yes, though there's no rationale given in the PR

Yeah this was intentional. We discussed this on the mailing list briefly and concluded that it would be a good idea to not add me to everything at once, but start slowly. I.e. just review rotation first, but not rfcbot.
But I agree, it would be a weird hybrid. It's also just strange right now as part of the "review job" is to start FCP merges.
If you want to take this on I think it’s fine to remove the exclusion
At the moment rfcbot considers that proposing FCP is itself a vote in favor of that proposal

At the moment rfcbot considers that proposing FCP is itself a vote in favor of that proposal

That makes sense, I guess

If you want to take this on I think it’s fine to remove the exclusion

Unfortunately, I don't think I'm ready to take this on yet. Currently, I don't yet have the feeling I am reviewing my PRs in a timely fashion, so I first want to get that under control before taking on more tasks.
Ah sorry, I didn't see this. I haven't tried to start an fcp merge. Generally I don't have the bandwidth to keep up with std PRs/reviews and such. Although I'm happy to be pinged on demand. :)
